intro: Cyrtanthus obrienii, commonly known as O'Brien's bell-shaped flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy blooms in late winter to early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Cyrtanthus obrienii is well-suited for rock gardens and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
